alert.note: Alert for Brown; Coleman; Kimble; Mason; McCulloch; Menard; San Saba (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 11 at 2:34AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...Heavy Rainfall and the Potential for Flash Flooding across West Central Texas this Weekend... A slow moving storm system will generate several rounds of showers and storms across West Central Texas this weekend. The first wave of storms will likely move across the area Friday evening into Saturday morning, producing heavy rainfall. Although much of West Central Texas will see at least periods of heavy rain, an area south of a Brownwood to San Angelo to Sonora line appears to be the main area of concern. This area has seen several episodes of heavy rainfall already this week, any additional rainfall will quickly run off and lead to the potential for flash flooding. Residents of West Central Texas with outdoor plans Friday Night into the Weekend should remain alert for the potential for heavy rainfall. Campers and other people near area creeks and streams should be vigilant for rapidly rising flood waters, even if it is not raining at your location at that time. Flash flooding may develop in a matter of minutes and produce life threatening conditions.

area.areaDesc: Brown; Coleman; Kimble; Mason; McCulloch; Menard; San Saba
